content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
												This is a fast paced insanely fun game with a great art style (reminiscent of the movie Incredibles) and a fun soundtrack. The beginning of SpeedRunners is a bit problematic for example it took me a while to figure out how to change the controls. And the story is only useful because of the new characters you can get, but the dialogue is painfully cliche. It's obvious that this is truly a great game but I would only recommend getting it if you have someone else to play with. PDHD gives this game a 7/10. Fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												So i'm only silver league but i've been playing this game for nearly 2 years and heres my honest opinion:I have always loved this game and it was such an exiting, enjoyable and competative experience. But since its released most of the few good Australian players stopped playing, or at least arent as active as they used to. This makes at least in my case very difficult to find a game at all. Let alone being evenly matched.Gameplay whise this game opens up so much room for skill developement and the constant strive to be the best. With the limited singleplayer replay value this pushes most players to the online area of Speedrunners. Online can be very pleasant and fun to play whether it be playing with some old mates or making new ones by yourself everyone on there seems to be mature and friendly.As the online connection is P2P (No servers), one person with faulty internet can pretty much ruin the experience of everyone else as it breaks the game most the time and you end up frozen in a game.Recently with the games release they have introduced trails for people to buy with microtransactions, this really felt out of place with the whole arcade style of the game and I have rarely seen people using them.Alltogether this is quite an amazing fun to play game, I reccomend buying a 4 pack and gifting it around as it is best played with friends!

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												I seriously looked at this game a while ago and thought it wouldn't be interesting. A couple friends and I decided to buy the game and check it out and 4 hours later we had some of the best fun in a LONG time. It's basically a fast-paced platforming game with powerups to hinder your friends (or foes) from beating you. The catch is after one person "dies" by falling off the screen, the screen begins to get smaller and smaller until it's small enough to barely fit 2 people. It's some of the best fun you'll have and I can guarantee you'll be angry and laughing at the same time.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												SpeedRunners - My personal reviewI bought this game in the official steam shop after it was mentioned in one of PewDiePie´s slightly older videos. It has been reduced by 75% from the original price so I payed about 4 euros in total, at this point my expectations weren´t that high so I first thought that i´d spend about 20 hours in the game. After a few matches and when i started to figure out the special mechanics that the game has it really started getting interesting and fun to play. Now I spent 46 hours in the game and that after about 6 weeks of buying it and after all this time its stil enjoyable and on top of that it became one of my favourite games i´ve ever played.It is a jump n´run multiplayer game without any type of story you need to mention, so there is a tutorial but the game is just about the gameplay and not about the graphics or the campaign.You shouldn´t buy this game if you´re looking for a revolutionary game in every point but if you´re into games like this its definetly worth youre money although i have to say that you should wait until its getting reduced again.-----EDIT------After they ve added a new "ELO" system, ranked gamplay isnt fun any longer. It is super buggy (f.e. some players do get around 20+ points for a win while others including me only getting +2 for every match, nevermind if they beat high or low elo players). If youre looking for a ranked focused jumpNrunner game i would not recommend you this anymore!

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								*This review is written from the point of view of someone who has only played singleplay and local multiplayer*SpeedRunners is a great arcade style racing game (if you can call it that) which is fast paced and great to play with friends and family. It's similar to popular kart racing games except you run rather than drive a kart.+Really nice art style +Plenty of cool skins to choose from for your character+Works well for local multiplayer+Good BOTs+Well designed and fun to play maps+From what I can tell it has a good competitive multiplayer system though I haven't played it myself+Reasonable price and good value for money+The Devs release new skins every so often+Fun to play+Good replayability+/-Relatively short matches, great if you just want a quick game of something-Not very many maps though it does have workshop support-Some of the items can be pretty annoyingVerdict:7A really fun game which is perfect for playing with family and friends

content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is an awesome game.While it mixes up the playstyle of Super Meat Bot, it also adds the speed of a racing game, the power-ups of any mario kart game and the grapple hook mechanism similar to the Just Cause series.The main plot of the game is cool, while there's a lot of main characters, there's still 2 Youtuber packs (which I find waaay unescessary to have, since they're only reskins and the players have no audio or anything, it's just visual), there's hidden characters too, while you can play as Wolf from PAYDAY 2 and as a potato.The game can be played up to 4 players, on an online match, or you can play with bots, choosing one of the three difficulties: Easy, medium or hard.Even that the game is competitive and smooth, it doesn't and won't lack the sense of fun. Just like in Mount Your Friends, if it wasn't by the hanging dongs and the nude characters, the game would be totally focused on the competitiviness it has, while in SpeedRunners, the game has a gayish character with a pink unicorn costume, and another character with a big red ball head with a star on it, symbolizing the comunism.The game has a nice plot, by first sight, since it involves all of an hero world where you need to save scientists from bombs.93/100

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								An amazing and near perfect "time-waster" game.  It is really great online and really rewards  (or punishes) risky plays.  A fantastic casual racer.  It is in my opinion played best 1 on 1 with a friend that you can beak at the entire time.  Online with 4 people certainly is fun, but can become fairly chaotic and 4 people with items can make it seem like luck changes the game instead of skill.  Nevertheless it is a blast.Overall an amazing game I would recommend to anyone.  the perfect casual time-waster, yet it can get extremely competitive.5 "Grapple Hook Fails" out of 5

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
Product received for free
												Speedrunners at it's core is a very addicting game and is something you can easily come back to if you want to have a fun time, I highly reccomend it to people who wish to try something different.Pros: Lots of unique and wonderfully animated characters, easy to pick up and play, skill level friendly (most of the time), workshop levels, trails, overall good community, soundtrack (except for 2 specific ones)Cons: matchmaking can be very unreliable when wanting to get ranked with people your rank, number of players drop to low amounts (usually from 12 AM to near 5-6 AM), smurfs, some cancerous people, and item spam on a few occasionsIf you can manage to get past all the cons, you have a fun, challenging game that's sure to reel you back in from time to time, and unlike a few other games I know the devs actually care for their game (having just recently come back from porting the game to consoles) and it's pricing is just right, but if that doesn't tickle your fancy, wait for a sale.

								10/10Would grapple again.A lot of fun, especially with friends. number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let me be clear: This is one of the best multiplayer games I have ever played. I bought FIVE copies total because you can't wait around all day for your idiot friends to buy their own copies - sometimes you have to take action yourself. This game is incredibly fun right now while in early access. You do not need to wait for release if you want to have amazing fun with your friends. You can do online and local multiplayer. If you can't tell from the store page, this game is a foot race with items to help you defeat your opponents. There are many advanced techniques you can use to defeat your opponents. After someone falls far enough behind to touch the edge of the screen, the screen will slowly get smaller and smaller eventually forcing out the other players. This is great as it doesnt allow rounds to go on endlessly while you are stuck waiting. Matches are very fast and there is very little not playing time. Some other games make you spend at least as much time waiting around in lobbies and loading screens as you do actual playing, but not this game. You are always right down to business. In conclusion, definitely buy this game.

This will frustrate you. A lot. In conclusion: Great offline game for local multiplayer! (Right now) horrible online experience!

content:
Posted: April 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								Updated: May 20 @ 12:28pm  2014   Update 6/12/2014  it just keeps getting better and user friendly.hours of crazy fun.  You can poop Box's on peoples heads.  10/10Edit:  After Several Hours Later i have a few things to really say about these games. As i hate those one liners that give a ten out of ten without explaining why. so here it goes.SpeedRunners is a awesome 4 player MultiPlayer  Hit and run type of Game. It reminds me a lot like Super Smash Brothers without as many weapons or players.  But its still in Beta.  Also  The Community.  Now there is no Speech to talk.  There is very little Chatting.  but its Jestures that show what type of player or peroson you are.  If you are a little bit or a lot better than other players.  Most players will wait up to make it more of a challenge for themselves, and to allow people with lesser of skills catch up.  Wonderful Community without Communication in game.  The Fun:  Non stop hours of fun you can use a Controller and up to 4 controllers i believe or 3  and a keyboard and mouse.  making this a fun game for the Big Screen TV on Big Pictuer mode playing your PC like a Consel.  Sweet!Being able to catch on Quickly.  This is important because some games it takes a real long time to catch on. Or they make something easy very hard.  this game is very str8 forward. The one player is fun and will teach you.  When you first turn on your game it immediatly puts you through  tut, that is short but to the point. you dont need to do these as the best way to learn is to jump in the action.Ranks: They have a ranking system that is very cool.  And i foresee this being a cool portion to SpeedRunners.Custom Levels and Level Modifier.  You can create your Own levels, or play other well built custom maps. one or two not so well built.  But most of them Rock, and can be voted on. i have yet to figure that part out. But they have WORKSHOP for this game. So Rock on!All in all if you want to play with your buddies this game is way worth the asking price, its worth the Full asking price. hell id pay 20 bucks for it.  Just to support the Developers and i do hope Tiny Build makes money off this and expands.   HAVE FUN AND RUN RUN RUN

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								*This review is written from the point of view of someone who has only played singleplay and local multiplayer*SpeedRunners is a great arcade style racing game (if you can call it that) which is fast paced and great to play with friends and family. It's similar to popular kart racing games except you run rather than drive a kart.+Really nice art style +Plenty of cool skins to choose from for your character+Works well for local multiplayer+Good BOTs+Well designed and fun to play maps+From what I can tell it has a good competitive multiplayer system though I haven't played it myself+Reasonable price and good value for money+The Devs release new skins every so often+Fun to play+Good replayability+/-Relatively short matches, great if you just want a quick game of something-Not very many maps though it does have workshop support-Some of the items can be pretty annoyingVerdict:7A really fun game which is perfect for playing with family and friends

content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
Product received for free
												Speedrunners at it's core is a very addicting game and is something you can easily come back to if you want to have a fun time, I highly reccomend it to people who wish to try something different.Pros: Lots of unique and wonderfully animated characters, easy to pick up and play, skill level friendly (most of the time), workshop levels, trails, overall good community, soundtrack (except for 2 specific ones)Cons: matchmaking can be very unreliable when wanting to get ranked with people your rank, number of players drop to low amounts (usually from 12 AM to near 5-6 AM), smurfs, some cancerous people, and item spam on a few occasionsIf you can manage to get past all the cons, you have a fun, challenging game that's sure to reel you back in from time to time, and unlike a few other games I know the devs actually care for their game (having just recently come back from porting the game to consoles) and it's pricing is just right, but if that doesn't tickle your fancy, wait for a sale.

												SpeedRunners is as if Mario Kart and Super Meat Boy had a baby. number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								I found Speedrunners because some friends wanted to play it, so I picked it up and had a blast. The music was fantastic, the mechanics were solid and the controls were tight. Now that that's out of the way...This game is glitchy, sometimes game-breakingly so. It's not rare for someone to go into the blast zone and not die. The physics gets janky sometimes too, I remember sliding up a wall and then flying 300 feet in the air and instantly dying because of it. Also, some stages are very...random as to deciding who's in first, expecially when a player is able to do something that doesn't follow the regular path of a level. This makes it frustrating for experienced players who find shortcuts, because about 1/2 of the time they work and you win, or the game just decides to kill you. Glitches aside, there is a lot of variety in the maps and qualities unique to each one, but there's just too few of them. As of right now, there's only 9 stages to play in the whole game. Granted that the devs have done SOMETHING to try and solve this by allowing players to make custom stages publish them so that everyone else can play them too. In theory, that's a great idea, let the community make their own maps, and the good ones get upvoted and the bad ones will be lost to the sands of time. In reality, in a game where the only objective is to run around a stage the fastest, mediocre level design sticks out trememdously. Also, I am damn sick of Smash Bros remakes.Lag really isn't much of an issue, and if it just so happens someone is lagging, the chances are very small that their lag will decide the game. +1 Paragon.What would decide the yay or nay for me is very simple. "Is there tension in this racing game?" The answer is yes, gratuitous amounts of it. The individual skills of each player grinding against one another creates tension in itself, but there's also items that you can pick up. This monumentally increases the depth of the game. For casual players, most items are used immediately with moderate effect  which gives the game a mariokart-esque feel. At higher levels (which surprisingly enough isn't that hard to reach) items are held until the exact moment where that specific item is going to be most effective. There's also a bit of thoughtful game design which I really wish we had more of in games in general. There's also a bit of game design genius surrounding the Golden Claw, the most powerful item in the game, but I won't get into that.Movement is tighter than a longbow string, no doubt about that. This makes it so that when you lose, you have only yourself to blame. Or that one♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥who used the Golden Hook RIGHT OVER THE SPIKES YOU SONOFA-Overall it's a fantastic game that's worth the ten bucks especially if you have some friends to play it with.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is far more fun and entertaining than I first thought when I got it. The idea is simplistic, 2d side scroller racing game, yet it has provided my friends and I hours of entertainment. It's great for LAN parties, where you can hear your friend rage at getting blown off the map by a bomb you set or being caught by your golden hook. The good:- Fun, fast paced gameplay- Well balanced items. None of the items seems overpowered and there is a way to dodge most of them if youre quick.- Wall jumping is well implemented and very smooth.- Grappling hook is fun.- Workshop level editor and the ability to play user created levels along with the official maps.- Ranked and unranked matchmaking, as well as the ability to make custom lobbies- Can use the keyboard (my preference) or game controllerNeeds Improvement:- Can be a bit glitchy sometimes, such as players teleporting through walls or floors, people winning when they weren't in first place sometimes, etc.- If your or your opponents internet connection or connection to the server isn't great it can cause your oppenents to teleport around the screen- Limited official maps. You go tend to memorize them pretty quickly.- Having to buy some of the characters is annoying, but understandable I suppose. Would be nice to have the ability to unlock them through gameplay- The single player campaign story is ok, but its kind of boring. Basically just a bunch of time trials (get to the bomb before it blows up) I don't have any ideas on how to make it better, but a little variety would go a long way.- The bots can be kind of dumb sometimes, running off the screen in the wrong direction or getting stuck at a paticular point and not being able to move past it.- The matchmaking needs a little work- Sometimes the ranked matches don't record your points properlyMost of the "Needs Improvement" section is just nitpicky stuff that I'm sure will be cleared up by full launch. I really have nothing bad to say about the game, and woudl definitely recomend playing it. It's easy to learn, takes time to master some of the techniques and is great to play with friends. Easily worth $10. If you can shell out $70+ for a carbon copy fps every year you can afford to drop $10 on this great game.

								Speedrunners, it's a fast paced indie game that's currently in beta. This game offers great gameplay with some bugs here and there. It's also very competitive, has good music, creative characters and ends friendships. This game also includes a level builder and some of your favorite youtubers. number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great party game. It has fast-paced action and replayability similar to Mario Kart, but with an interesting take on the conventional gameplay often seen in the genre. I'm not a great fan of the art style and I do feel the game's interface is clunky at times. It's also hard to distinguish between certain characters and for some maps it's hard to spot the proper route, even after a couple of rounds.But key component for any party game is strong gameplay and SpeedRunners has that in abundance. Although it's certainly not the perfect game, it is highly enjoyable.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								Let's face it, Speed running is a thing. It has exploded in popularity thanks to YouTube and Twitch, and has even spawned gaming charities. It was only a matter of time before a game based around this phenomena was released. While there is a decent single-player component to the game, the real light shines when you take it online and join in with the community. It's fast-paced mayhem with plenty of strategy involved. Not only will you develop your own playing style, but it will have to change on the fly depending on the level as well as the strategies of the other players. This might be why I love this game so much - you have to prepare for constant change.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Speedrunners is probably one of the most addictive games out here on steam. I've seen alot of streams before I decided to buy this great, amusing/entertaining game title. First of, I've started with some of the singleplayer missions which, in my opinion, are not necessary to get into the real multiplayer gameplay. Mutliplayer is fun, you can either do custom matches or hop in into ranked matches directly. I've played 80% of my gametime with friends in custom matches, beside normal maps we've tried maps from the workshop - some were good, some more like mehhhh. Anyways, if you've ever played this game, you won't stop playing it. I just stopped playing it because my friends got bored by me beating them :pSpeedrunners is often for sale, just come back regularly and check the price - I woudl recommend buying it for the normal price, but as a student I feel anyone else in the same situation where money is rare. Anyways, the game is worth the 10 bucks - Buy it, love it, get addicted to it.

Posted: February 19
												I used to go for a morning jog every day, then the Communist Robot Pirate Army decided that everyone should be fat. I was very displeased at first, until I found out that Steam exists. I really wanted to find a running game since I could no longer run. I found SpeedRunners, and I can safely say that this game made me want to kill myself. My friends say I'm so good at SpeedRunners, so they all quit talking to me because I was such a God. Kim Jong Un found out about it and challenged me to a duel. I used the golden grapple ability move and pulled him into the spikes. Bad idea. He exiled me from North Korea and I had to suck off the Canadian Prime Minister in order to become a citizen there. Now I can have my morning jog every day, and I can play the occasional game of SpeedRunners with my friends and Kim Jong Un.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
												Don't buy this. It's 15 dollars for a game thats fun for about 3 hours. Not to mention, you unlock characters/levels/items through leveling up, and this game literally has one of the slowest level up systems ever. It takes up to 50 matches to go up one level, and one match can be anywhere between 2 minutes to 20 minutes. The online community is full of incredibly toxic people and annoying kids who won't stop spamming the chat with "♥♥♥♥ing hackers, stop using the golden hookshot!". The maps are very bland and short, and despite the fact there are about 25 or so maps, only 4-5 ever get chosen. The ranked matchmaking system makes no sense and unfairly places people, no matter how many matches you win or lose. The art style is simple and sleek, and I do like the art style, but the interesting artistic style is wasted on the poor character designs. Look up some of the characters, and just see how ugly they look, not just in game, but also in their menu screen images/round win images. Characters like the Japanese cat, Sherlock Bones and the Shark are just painful to look at (I just call them by what they are, because I'm not taking the time to remember the names of over 30 hideous characters).The servers on online are also terrible. Every 1/20 games you play or so you will have nobody that lags. Every single game, everybody is lagging, or someone is lagging out the server, or the game is glitching. It also doesn't help that there are only at one time about 1600-1800 people online, and despite that it tries its best to pair you in the same server multiple times. I played a match in which it was me and 2 other people. I managed to beat the other person, but the camera was stuck on an AFK player, playing Skullduggery. I couldn't even see my character, yet i was alive, and I ended up just being stuck and running around. After about 2 minutes, I just exploded and Skullduggery won. The game is incredibly buggy, full of toxic children, and people that shout "HACKER" at good players, and every once and a while a legitmate hacker shows up and ruins the fun. Seriously though, over 40 characters, over 20 maps, and yet almost every character is poorly designed and only 4-5 maps are chosen? Barely any content, stupid, overpriced game with overpriced sell-out "YOUTUBE POPULAR MEME!" DLC, and overall I just can't recommend this game. It's too small, has no playerbase, and has very little content. Fun for about 3-4 hours. It sucks that I played for 3 hours and 10 minutes, because if i didn't spend that 10 minutes I would definetly request a refund.

content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								Memory based running game... not really "racing".This game is more of a memory game than a "racing" game. The game handicaps players for being faster or pulling ahead of others.  The game's camera will only really follow the second place runner, so if you're in first place, you're running blind (at which point you hit obstacles, traps, and other pitfalls.)  The game punishes 1st place runners, and offers endless "catch up" opportunities for 2nd, 3rd, and 4th place.Basically, if this were a racing game, it would be the equivalent of a car racing game where the further ahead you were in 1st place, the darker your screen gets; until pitch black.  It's a very fun game, but the camera handicapping the 1st place runner is enough to make me dislike it.

I mean lets look at the gameplay. What do you do> GO FAST! What does sonic do? Go fast? WHAT? A COINKYDINK? I DONT THINK SO! DO YOU?! Next up we got graphics, and you can twll with this one based off of the colours and all of the shading as well as the pixels that they were going for a sega megasis look from the originol Sonic 1. Clearly a rip off. Next up we got story. It is clearly mocking the early sonic trend of having literally no story, I mean cooommme oooon. At this point the only thing this has above sonic is that you can race with other, slightly different coloured sonics. Next up, is sound. Musics good 10/10

												No game is playable if the mechanics are♥♥♥♥♥♥ Thankfully, SpeedRunners game mechanics are pretty great, some glitches in maps under special circumstances (SuperSpeed is huge for breaking maps) but overall definitely a game I'd recommend picking up, however, only if on sale. 												I like this game alot, but thats not all! here, have a baking recipe for fried chicken(for those who are smart enough to realise i said "bake" instead of "cook". Congratulations)Ingredients3 eggs1/3 cup waterAbout 1 cup hot red pepper sauce (recommended: Texas Pete)2 cups self-rising flour1 teaspoon pepperHouse seasoning, recipe follows1 (1 to 2 1/2-pound) chicken, cut into piecesOil, for frying, preferably peanut oilHouse Seasoning:1 cup salt1/4 cup black pepper1/4 cup garlic powderADD CHECKED ITEMS TO GROCERY LISTDirectionsIn a medium size bowl, beat the eggs with the water. Add enough hot sauce so the egg mixture is bright orange. In another bowl, combine the flour and pepper. Season the chicken with the house seasoning. Dip the seasoned chicken in the egg, and then coat well in the flour mixture.Heat the oil to 350 degrees F in a deep pot. Do not fill the pot more than 1/2 full with oil.Fry the chicken in the oil until brown and crisp. Dark meat takes longer than white meat. It should take dark meat about 13 to 14 minutes, white meat around 8 to 10 minutes.House Seasoning:Mix ingredients together and store in an airtight container for up to 6 months.got this recipe from: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/paula-deen/southern-fried-chicken-recipe.htmlEnjoy

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is a mainly a multiplayer runner in which the goal is to run off the screen and leave the other players/bots in the dust. There's many obstacles in the way such as items from other players/bots, spikes, and sometimes the map it self. There's things that hold it back though, and I'll talk about them as well. Single-Player When I first launched SpeedRunners singleplayer I played it for a bit before going back to playing with my friends, I didn't touch it since. When was this you maybe asking? This summer (2014). So that's telling you 2 things: 1) my experience wasn't very good (this might also might make you think about buying it if you're planning to play it SP alot) and 2) My experience and thoughts aren't very fresh. Now you know this, I'll go on to my SP review.The singleplayer side isn't very good. You can play with bot, or some little missions. The missions are only fun for a bit but then, you'll be wanting to play with people soon after. I played with bots but I don't get the same laughs or great fun I get with real players.  Multi-Player Ah, the meat and potatoes of the game, the multiplayer. This games biggest feature is the multiplayer. I spent pretty much all my time playing online  with friends  . The multiplayer contains: online with friends, online with randoms, and local. There's more to talk about so I'll break up the 3 big ways of multiplayer.Online w/ Friends- Playing this game with friends and talking to each other on Skype/Teamspeak/Mumble is the best way to play this game. It goes along so prefectly that I really think this game should be bundled with Skype/Teamspeak/Mumble. The game itself online with friends without any voice chat opened will make the game become stale fast. The game will just turn into playing with bots and (maybe) some lag. If your planning on playing with friends, your most likely going to talk on a voice chat anyways.Online w/ Strangers- Sorry I can't really give out much about this mode becuase, I really haven't played this mode at all. But it's pretty much the same as playing with friends w/o voice chat and I also belive that some of the match  customization is gone.Local- Again. haven't played much of this mode to fully give you my opinions on it. As of right now, I'm guessing this is the one of the best ways to play with friends becuase, it'll cut away the potential lag and plus, gaming localy is always fun. Verdict The game's biggest thing holding it up is the gameplay with friends. If your not planning on playing this game with friends there's also online with strangers or singleplayer options but, if your planing on playing this w/o friends I wouldn't recomend this game at all. It's not worth the $11 price tag. 7/10  Please don't just look just this review, there's better reviews out there that show more than me

The reason why you can´t stop playing SpeedRunners...isn´t just as easy to answer ;) A few weeks ago we stumbled across the Steam sale of SpeedRunners. Since then I spent some time improving my racing skills on that game (sharp tongues assert that there is no improvement ;-) )  Tzzz! Ok, the game is really hard to play against opponents online within the league sytem. But I would highly reccomend it playing against friends and family. A few days ago I had a close race against my husband. If you´re interested watch the video below. Sorry, it is in German but it has English subtitles. Anyway, it´s a good way to see the variety of maps, weapons, traps and gameplay if you´re deciding whether to buy it or not. There are also a lot of custom maps avalaible. It seems like there is a highly active community. Definitely a game to keep in mind! See you there! tRini

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners: Gotta Go FastSpeedRunners is a 2-D Race Battle game that pits you and three friends (or Random Online Gamers) against each other to see who can best out-run, out-trick, and out-trap.You start off by picking one of the four characters you want to play as. There is no real difference in who you choose, as this game is all about the skill of the person playing. Once everyone has decided, the stage must be selected. Each zone/level is comprised of different layouts, paths, and ways to get around. From lasers to platform triggers to speed boost paths and beyond, this little game has a surprising amount of awesome contained within. From left to right, the stages increase in complexity, with the first stage being simple & memorable and the last stage being somewhat frustrating.Sometimes upon start, a "wheel of fortune" style level mod will pop up, but as far as i've been able to see, it is completely randomized. It has the possible outcomes of: Increased Speed, All Items Are Grab Claws, or Rockets Raining Down From The Skies. Speed is fun, Grab Claws make the match very tricky, and Rockets are pretty annoying.After the 3,2,1, you're off. (On a personal side-note, I highly recommend playing this game using an Xbox 360 wired controller as opposed to the keyboard. It is by far easier.) Characters have several different abilities: Jump, Double Jump, Slide, Use Item, Swing Grapple, and Speed Boost. All of these being mastered are absolutely essential to winning, but without a doubt, timing is the most crucial asset. Swing Grapple at the right time for a speed boost, slide under a wall to take a quicker path, speed boost when your opponents are far behind, you name it. There are numerous strategies of ways to win, and most come with experience & learning the layout of the stages. In order to win, opponent players have to fall behind/get caught off-screen. The first person to acquire three wins in the winner.-------------------------------------Overall Ratings-------------------------------------*Gameplay: (9/10) - Smooth & Fun.*Graphics: (7/10) - Not too much on the design/some empty feeling areas, but on the flip side, that prevents distractions.*Sound: (7/10) - Generic sounds & music, but they can get you pumped for the race.*Character Designs: (8/10) - Definitely some unique choices.*Stage Layouts: (7/10) - Some are more frustrating than fun.*Items & Weapons: (9/10) - Add fantastic strategy to the game. *Replayability: (10/10) - If it keeps your interest, all you do is replay it.*Fun Factor: (9/10) - Overall, this game is fantastic. I'm always down for a few rounds.Quick Matches, Fun Gameplay, Endless Replayability, Clever Weapons & Items, and a great original game like nothing i've ever played before make for a fantastic gaming experience.~9/10~

Little did I know that every emotion I knew I had would be coming out of me at every instance this game offers. The game's premise goes off the main title: You are speedrunners. Your goal: to run speed-ily. The mechanics are very close to being a 2D MarioKart. So slap on three other friends and you're having yourself a yell-fest. Tension, frustration, sadness and joy are all had (Just trying to connect sometimes!). The item balance isn't always perfect but if you know the maps well enough you can come back from almost anything. I highly recommend this game to friends that play in a group of 3-4 people, it's given us more than enough replayability.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
Early Access Review
								While the recently added single player adds a lot of fun and allows you to learn the basics (and not so basics if you want to get a mean score), this game is clearly more suited for couch co-op. Having weapons that not only speed you up but slow others down is fertile ground for yelling at people near you. It's really cleverly balanced too, because as everyone shares the same screen, the person in the lead can see the least amount of screen and therefore must simply react to what the level gives them, instead of purposefully moving in the fastest route.Looking forward to having some more stuff to do online (stat tracking etc) but I've got high hopes as most of the work seems to be done.

								Just one more lap. Just one more an-"You have lost please select your method of Failure from the options below:A] - Camera BugB] - Enemy Player LatencyC] - Grappled to DeathD] - Killed by the 4th Placed PlayerE] DrillF] Fair Game"Its a brilliant platform racing game, some of the maps really do need tweaks (Some "shortcuts" are infact slower or more likely to induce death than just boost abusing the normal route), some of the weapons do need reworking (imo only the SonicBoom weapon is balanced) and finally the camera recognition really needs fixing. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunner. Ooooooh boy...What a game.First, let's start off with the good things. The grappling system is really, really fun to use. The races are fast paced. The items, while all of them very useful, have ways you can block them, so they never seem unfair. The maps are well design with many ways to get ahead of the competition. The occasional gamemode roulette always adds some variety to matches.There are some bad things, however. While there five characters at the moment, and each of them has 4 color variants, they don't differ themselves gameplay-wise. Conection issues can be a problem as well. And there are several gamemode roulettes that are really annoying, such as the one called "SpeedRapture," where missiles rain down from the skies. However, there aren't a whole lot of bad things wrong with this game.Overall, I really enjoy this game. 8/10.

The comic style looks fantastic, there isn't much variety in music as of now but I hope this will change with time, seeing as it's Early Access. Mechanically, everything is intact, however some of the backend still needs work. For example, there's trouble with disconnects and lag in game, leading to (sometimes) unwinnable rounds that only end when you quit. Let's hope that this gets fixed, as this is definitely a game to look out for!

content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
Early Access Review
								Grappling hooks are the finest form of movement in games, and thus in life (followed closely by jetpacks). The developers of Speedrunners recognise this and have thus created a masterpiece in pick up and play design with a meaty core. Few things embody the old adage of 'easy to learn, difficult to master' quite so well as this fine game. Admittedly, one's enjoyment is increased by many orders of magnitude when playing with friends.Unlike many games under the Early Access banner this is no lazy alpha. All the important elements are here and the developers frequently add to the experience, responding quickly to bug reports and player feedback.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is a mainly a multiplayer runner in which the goal is to run off the screen and leave the other players/bots in the dust. There's many obstacles in the way such as items from other players/bots, spikes, and sometimes the map it self. There's things that hold it back though, and I'll talk about them as well. Single-Player When I first launched SpeedRunners singleplayer I played it for a bit before going back to playing with my friends, I didn't touch it since. When was this you maybe asking? This summer (2014). So that's telling you 2 things: 1) my experience wasn't very good (this might also might make you think about buying it if you're planning to play it SP alot) and 2) My experience and thoughts aren't very fresh. Now you know this, I'll go on to my SP review.The singleplayer side isn't very good. You can play with bot, or some little missions. The missions are only fun for a bit but then, you'll be wanting to play with people soon after. I played with bots but I don't get the same laughs or great fun I get with real players.  Multi-Player Ah, the meat and potatoes of the game, the multiplayer. This games biggest feature is the multiplayer. I spent pretty much all my time playing online  with friends  . The multiplayer contains: online with friends, online with randoms, and local. There's more to talk about so I'll break up the 3 big ways of multiplayer.Online w/ Friends- Playing this game with friends and talking to each other on Skype/Teamspeak/Mumble is the best way to play this game. It goes along so prefectly that I really think this game should be bundled with Skype/Teamspeak/Mumble. The game itself online with friends without any voice chat opened will make the game become stale fast. The game will just turn into playing with bots and (maybe) some lag. If your planning on playing with friends, your most likely going to talk on a voice chat anyways.Online w/ Strangers- Sorry I can't really give out much about this mode becuase, I really haven't played this mode at all. But it's pretty much the same as playing with friends w/o voice chat and I also belive that some of the match  customization is gone.Local- Again. haven't played much of this mode to fully give you my opinions on it. As of right now, I'm guessing this is the one of the best ways to play with friends becuase, it'll cut away the potential lag and plus, gaming localy is always fun. Verdict The game's biggest thing holding it up is the gameplay with friends. If your not planning on playing this game with friends there's also online with strangers or singleplayer options but, if your planing on playing this w/o friends I wouldn't recomend this game at all. It's not worth the $11 price tag. 7/10  Please don't just look just this review, there's better reviews out there that show more than me

Anyway, it´s a good way to see the variety of maps, weapons, traps and gameplay if you´re deciding whether to buy it or not. There are also a lot of custom maps avalaible. It seems like there is a highly active community. Definitely a game to keep in mind! See you there! tRini

content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Best: ~ Multiplayer: The competition amongt friends and randoms is amazing. ~ Item Variation: The different tactics on using items (when and where). ~ Levels: Enjoy the variations in level design and routes to beat the competition. The Okay: ~ Sometimes unstable score reporting for Origins. Got a higher score but never sent it to the server. ~ Maybe it is just me but the different characters have a different feel. Recommendations:All in all the game is great multiplayer game and a great time-trial aspect with Origins. An added feature that I would love to see is to disable the items to see the true potential of people running the maps. Sometimes too much chaos is a bad thing.LOVE THE GAME.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								I love platformers. I love local multiplayer games. I love this freaking game. Even with it being early access it is very polished. As people have mentioned, this totally brings me back to the days of playing Smash Bros. ans Mario Kart. Crazy competition, people yelling back and forth, beer being spilled from wild flailing. There are some excellent design decisions made here.The way a player wins a "round" is genius and leads to incredibly tense moments every 30 seconds. The powerups are also well done and perfectly compliment the rest of the gameplay.I can't wait to see where the devs take this concept. They've really got something fun and unique here.

												I like this game alot, but thats not all! here, have a baking recipe for fried chicken(for those who are smart enough to realise i said "bake" instead of "cook". Congratulations)Ingredients3 eggs1/3 cup waterAbout 1 cup hot red pepper sauce (recommended: Texas Pete)2 cups self-rising flour1 teaspoon pepperHouse seasoning, recipe follows1 (1 to 2 1/2-pound) chicken, cut into piecesOil, for frying, preferably peanut oilHouse Seasoning:1 cup salt1/4 cup black pepper1/4 cup garlic powderADD CHECKED ITEMS TO GROCERY LISTDirectionsIn a medium size bowl, beat the eggs with the water. Add enough hot sauce so the egg mixture is bright orange. In another bowl, combine the flour and pepper. Season the chicken with the house seasoning. Dip the seasoned chicken in the egg, and then coat well in the flour mixture.Heat the oil to 350 degrees F in a deep pot. Do not fill the pot more than 1/2 full with oil.Fry the chicken in the oil until brown and crisp. Dark meat takes longer than white meat. It should take dark meat about 13 to 14 minutes, white meat around 8 to 10 minutes.House Seasoning:Mix ingredients together and store in an airtight container for up to 6 months.got this recipe from: http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/paula-deen/southern-fried-chicken-recipe.htmlEnjoy

content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunner. Ooooooh boy...What a game.First, let's start off with the good things. The grappling system is really, really fun to use. The races are fast paced. The items, while all of them very useful, have ways you can block them, so they never seem unfair. The maps are well design with many ways to get ahead of the competition. The occasional gamemode roulette always adds some variety to matches.There are some bad things, however. While there five characters at the moment, and each of them has 4 color variants, they don't differ themselves gameplay-wise. Conection issues can be a problem as well. And there are several gamemode roulettes that are really annoying, such as the one called "SpeedRapture," where missiles rain down from the skies. However, there aren't a whole lot of bad things wrong with this game.Overall, I really enjoy this game. 8/10.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Often times I tell myself that I will only go for a round or two and end up playing for about an hour or more. This game is, once you've learned the basics, addictive as heck. The comic style looks fantastic, there isn't much variety in music as of now but I hope this will change with time, seeing as it's Early Access. Mechanically, everything is intact, however some of the backend still needs work. For example, there's trouble with disconnects and lag in game, leading to (sometimes) unwinnable rounds that only end when you quit. Let's hope that this gets fixed, as this is definitely a game to look out for!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
Early Access Review
								Grappling hooks are the finest form of movement in games, and thus in life (followed closely by jetpacks). The developers of Speedrunners recognise this and have thus created a masterpiece in pick up and play design with a meaty core. Few things embody the old adage of 'easy to learn, difficult to master' quite so well as this fine game. Admittedly, one's enjoyment is increased by many orders of magnitude when playing with friends.Unlike many games under the Early Access banner this is no lazy alpha. All the important elements are here and the developers frequently add to the experience, responding quickly to bug reports and player feedback.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												Spent over 10 hours playing this with my friends (don't mind the playtime on my account, spent most of the time playing this on my friends's PC) and believe me, this game is an endless fun generator.You may think it gets boring over time since there's nothing new to discover or to do but no. Original characters, cool power-ups, great levels (thank you based Steam Workshop), and addictive as hell gameplay. You polish your skills with every run and the more experienced you get, the more intense the battles between you and your friends get. And that's what makes this game fun. Many would say this is a pretty much skill-based game but the best thing about it is that skill doesn't matter here as long as one mistake / competent power-up (even the ones which some players may find useless) usage may change the situation completely. Local versus mode makes it even more fun than it already is. We spent the whole night playing this game with my friends  and just couldn't stop. I hope you'll like it just as we did. If you need something to play with friends - get this without any hesitation. You won't regret it, ok?

Early Access Review
								Do not buy unless you are in possesion of a gamepad and up to 3 friends you want to throw in the dirt with your superior racing skills.It's a good game for what it is and it delivers superbly.A 2D sidescroll racer which lightens the competetive heart of everyone who plays it and with taunts that tear friendships apart. A variety of tools, depending on how you use them, to either help you win or lose a match by your own hands.Challenging maps and the ability to create your own hellish maps to fullfill your dirty and wicked fantasy.For a seemingly small game the online multiplayer capabilies are existing AND working! That's something not every DEV can be proud of.Facit: buy a 4 player pack in the next sale, lure your friends to play with you with the intention to make them regret they did.#Wurf #FriendshipBroken

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is an innovative, online and offline, multiplayer racing game where you're running. It can get quite tense and it's fun to play. There are various items that you can pick up and use against your opponents (similar to the Mario Kart games) that add to the enjoyment of the game. It also gives you the option of playing a race with various different rules such as all pickups are one particular item, or everybody runs super fast, or the course is flipped around. You can select a specific rule or you can have a wheel spin before the race and the wheel selects what the special rule is. Or you can just play the game normally with no special rules. If you're looking for something in the racing genre that's a little different, and also enjoyable to play (especially with family and friends), I highly recommend SpeedRunners

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pros: Speedrunners installs super fast. It's fun, very fast-paced, and really cutthroat (which makes it more fun.) :DVery colorful, nice art style. Nice music/sound effects. Seems like it will run on just about anything.Cons: Controls take a little while to get used to, as it's all keyboard. Set your controls from the main menu, not in game!(it doesn't like to save your settings every time otherwise.)Sound's a little broken sometimes, but nothing that really effects gameplay.Overall: Totally worth the money for how addictive it is. GET IT! :D

content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is my 3rd review on this game as it is constantly improving.  My original review was a "not recommend" and they have already fixed most of my original gripes.  I highly recommend this game for anybody that is competitive that enjoys a tough challenge.PROS:  Very competitive onlineSkill depth (look up Taters McShit on youtube)Fun and Addictive for any skill levelCONS:Items Ruin Ranked - This is a biggie for me.  Basically the cheesier you play, the more you'll win and the saltier your opponent will be.  I think this is cancerous for the community and probably why so few people play this game.  Small Community - I find myself playing the same people every day. A lot of the time, nobody's online so I get mis-matched with players that are either way better than me, or way worse than me.Join Lag - If you're in a race and someone joins, the game lags out and will usually cost you the round.  Very frusterating.SUGGESTION:Make ranked matches without items.  Or atleast make it to where people can choose their own item settings and item options are randomly chosen between player's preferences each game.  Or you could reward people with extra rank up points for using no items.  It would also be great if there was a way to tech hitstun from an item (kinda like smash) to get up faster if executed properly.  Either way, their should be a way to offset the items.  Look at any game that has items/pickups (smash bros, mario kart, Halo, TF, etc.).  All of those games competitive ruleset is to play without items/pickups.  By forcing people to play with items on, you're closing the door to more potential players.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2014
the ranked game matchmaking is so trash that it doesn't work.i'm beginner league, rank 2 (doesn't really fit for me honestly, because i joined in late), and i get paired with someone 3-4 ranks above me.i lose most of the time of course, but even when i lose i gain ELO.also half the time the "winning moves" are really just exploits that weren't really planned to be used in the orginal mappros:- fun racing game with friends.- skill impacts (WAY) more than RNG, item drops.- made it out of early access, i guess that's kind of a pro.cons:- camera is literally so attrocious, it's a joke. and because the camera matters in win/lose situations, it's kind of a key element, and doesn't really pair well when ♥♥♥♥ed in the other direction.- (VERY) easilly exploited.- matchmaking works half the time.- limited gameplay.- you can gain and lose ELO from playing workshop maps in ranked, which aren't usually played for obvious reasons, and to add insult to injury, you don't even gain XP from playing these maps in non-competitive modes. please remove workshop maps from ranked pool.- very small base of players (<750 when i play, peak is usually 800).is it a bad game? not entirely, more like a "the community makes it bad" kinda game.it's definately worth the money, if it's on sale. also, if you don't have friends to play it with, it'll be way less fun. are more cons than pros a bad thing? not always. like i said, friends make this game 10x more fun.beta was a blast, release was somewhat underwhelming, and still kinda feels like a beta game, with several bugs.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 5
Product received for free
												Speedrunners is the best: Racing, Obstacle and Speedrunning game I have played in a while. This game is incredible and it is by far, my favourite competitive multiplayer game. It has a very nice gameplay but has been brought down by the lack of connection to almost every player although I have low ping on countries around the world in games like CSGO and Rust. I am hoping this will be improved and the community will grow. Want to find out what I think of this Audio - I think the explosions and soundtrack is very intense, especially in ranked. I think they need to add some other audio tracks instead of having the exact same one every level i play. It does get annoying quite a lot so. I rate Audio 7/10. Gameplay - There are 4 game modes and over 10 different game add-ons (i.e Lethal Spikes). Practice, Casual, Ranked and Story. The goal of each level is to outrun your competitors and outrun them out of the screen. Once they are off screen, they are dead. There are also power ups which could be like; missiles, grappling hook, fireball, freeze ray, drill etc. These make the game intense but for every single powerup, there is a way to dodge it. For example, if there is a grappling hook coming out of nowhere, all you have to do is press the slide key and you can dodge it. There are many obstacles like blocks which you have to slide under, spikes that if you land on them you are stunned and more. Finally, we have game add-ons. These can be acquired by levelling up. This means while ingame (practice or online), the host can put these on. For example, ‘Lethal spikes’ means that if you land on the spike, you die. Characters - There is not much to say here. While levelling up, you also unlock new characters and skins. When you start, you are given the default 4 characters. Comrade, Unic, Hothead and Speedrunner. While levelling up, you also get characters like Neko. There is one thing i found out recently. If you do a command like ‘/gangbeast’ or ‘/wolf’ you get characters from different games. /gangbeast gives you all the colour gang beasts from the silly physics game. ‘/wolf’ ‘/dallas’ ‘/houston’ and more give you the famous characters from the Payday series.Trails - There is hardly anything to say. When you start off, you get the normal boring trail which is your character moving fast. BUT, If you go to the trail store or community store, you can buy trails like i have and others like ‘Angel’ and ‘Spectrum’ and ‘Unic’. In the store, they range from £0.79 / $1 but in the community hub, they range from £0.49 / $0.70 - £1.49 / $2. These are recommended if you want to look like a famous player.Graphics / Visuals - The visuals are really nice and smooth. They have no pixels and look very well designed.+ Good graphics+ Good Sound Effects+ Incredible Gameplay+ Fun obstacles+ Many Gamemodes+ Secret Characters+ Many Characters+ Cheap Character Trail+ Not many microtransactions required (unless you want the Youtuber packs)+ Difficult but fun- Repetitive Audio- Terrible Connections- A ton of hackersOverall, 9.5/10 game

There are also power ups which could be like; missiles, grappling hook, fireball, freeze ray, drill etc. These make the game intense but for every single powerup, there is a way to dodge it. For example, if there is a grappling hook coming out of nowhere, all you have to do is press the slide key and you can dodge it. There are many obstacles like blocks which you have to slide under, spikes that if you land on them you are stunned and more. Finally, we have game add-ons. These can be acquired by levelling up. This means while ingame (practice or online), the host can put these on. For example, ‘Lethal spikes’ means that if you land on the spike, you die. Characters - There is not much to say here. While levelling up, you also unlock new characters and skins. When you start, you are given the default 4 characters. Comrade, Unic, Hothead and Speedrunner. While levelling up, you also get characters like Neko. There is one thing i found out recently. If you do a command like ‘/gangbeast’ or ‘/wolf’ you get characters from different games. /gangbeast gives you all the colour gang beasts from the silly physics game. ‘/wolf’ ‘/dallas’ ‘/houston’ and more give you the famous characters from the Payday series.Trails - There is hardly anything to say. When you start off, you get the normal boring trail which is your character moving fast. BUT, If you go to the trail store or community store, you can buy trails like i have and others like ‘Angel’ and ‘Spectrum’ and ‘Unic’. In the store, they range from £0.79 / $1 but in the community hub, they range from £0.49 / $0.70 - £1.49 / $2. These are recommended if you want to look like a famous player.Graphics / Visuals - The visuals are really nice and smooth. They have no pixels and look very well designed.+ Good graphics+ Good Sound Effects+ Incredible Gameplay+ Fun obstacles+ Many Gamemodes+ Secret Characters+ Many Characters+ Cheap Character Trail+ Not many microtransactions required (unless you want the Youtuber packs)+ Difficult but fun- Repetitive Audio- Terrible Connections- A ton of hackersOverall, 9.5/10 game

content:
Posted: April 21
												This game solves the biggest problem most other racing games have, it moves the finishline with the racers. Most racing games conform to reality a little too much by having an static finishline, which is easy to understand for player of all ages, but at the same time makes for a race that is exciting for only 10% of the actual racing time. This game makes 100% of your racing experience thrilling by having the finishline SO CLOSE and SO FAR at the same time, all the time. Its the perfect compliment to the digital format of being a video game, that we dont have to conform to physical laws of reality by shifting what would have been a static destination.This game is great!

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is one of those games that has a simple concept and a gameplay that is really easy to understand but also has a lot of room for improvement, it requires a lot of practice to get good at. I've watched this game grow and get better in so many ways and I simply can not recommend it enough, even in the early acces stage. The gameplay is fast, just like the name suggests, the controls are responsive and player skill makes a huge difference, to the point where, the only only way to win, becomes consistency and the strategic usage of items. The community isn't as big as I wanted it to be, but it's enough for you to find players in the same league (leagues being some sort of rank system within the game, the first one being the Entry League); but you might get in a room with someone a league or two above you, which isn't completely bad, since you can learn a lot just by looking at what those that are better than you are doing.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												This game is the boss. If you are a fan of competive and fun local multiplayer games then very few games match the finess of this title. Its fast, its hectic,there is a fair amount of skill involved and you have a wealth of opportunities to screw your friends over. Its awesome.The game mechanic and the goal is very simple. You have run , jump and grapple a head of the pack and then extend your lead until all the others are out of the screen.  Only thing is, you cant see too much ahead and your friends have got nasty abilities to screw you over with. So good luck and good speed :PAs always with local mp games, 4 is the perfect number of players.Exellent entertainment.9/10PS: do yourself a favor and dont play it alone, you will only find it a lesser game than it really is. This game is designed to ruin your relationships and loose frinds over.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is another one of those games that makes you want to kill your friends, like Super Smash Bros. In fact, the best way to describe Speedrunners is "Mario Kart meets Super Smash Bros." The gameplay is essentially one huge looping race, and you have to outrun your opponents until they hit the border, and thus killing them.Each math has 3 rounds, and if you win 3, you win the match. The game has a lot of Parkour-esque platforming that is really enjoyable and fun; double jumping, wall-jumping, sliding and grappling your way to victory. The real fun comes with the items though, as you can use these to mess up the other players and  get in their way. Every item is useful, and every item needs to be used correctly. They also require precise timing to hit, and precise timing to dodge. Every item in the game can be countered, making none of the items feel overpowered at any point whatsoever. Much like the item usage, everything in this game is precise. You need precisely timed button presses and jumps in order to win. You usually have no one to blame but yourself for losing, and it's great...usually. One of the major issues is the lag when playing online. On several occasions, I died due to horrible lag in the game. Luckily, this only happens while playing online with random players. When playing with friends or locally, it seems to run just fine.The level design is fantastic; every stage looks great, and they are well-though out, with multple shortcuts, and how to get them, along with many traps. Sometimes, these traps can feel a bit cheap (the spikes in particualr are really bad), but they are overall pretty good. The character designs are also pretty awesome, as every character looks cool, and you want to play as all of them jut to see what their animations are. However, I wish that the characters played differently from eachother. There is zero difference in playstyle between characters, and that is disappointing to say the least. No stats, no special abilities, nothing. It makes the game feel devoid of strategy and tactics. And while most of the game is reaction and skill-based, it would've been nice to have some strategy involved, outside of item usage.Something else that's disappointing is a lack of a story mode. I like stories in video games, and if the game doesn't have a story, that's understandable. But the problem is that the characters and the stages are so well designed, hat I would like to know about the world. In fact, during loading screens, you'll occasionally see characters making a remark or two about another character, and it just makes me wonder what is going on in this world. But comparatively, that's a minor complaint, as the gameplay is good enough to make up for it. The gmae also lacks content, as every race is pretty straightforward. I would've liked to see a few extra modes such as a battle mode, or something to mix up the gameplay. I also think that the game is very had, as you start out in the entry league, and so you are matched up wih players who are also in the entry league, and are more or less just as good as you are at the game. If you win a match, you get around 40 to 60 points, but losing will make you lose around 5 to 20 points. And trust me, you'll be losing ALOT at first, due to the slightly confusing controls and play style that takes alot of getting used to. This makes it almost impossible to reach higher rankings and be paired up with people who are really good at the game to get some challenge every now and then. However, despite all my complaints with the game, I still highly recommend Speedrunners. The gameplay, while it has a learning curve, is extremely fun and addictive. You'll play for hours on end, not realizing that you just wasted 3 hours of your life away. The complaints, though plentiful, aren't that bad and they are outwieghed by the good that the game has. And frankly, most of these issues come from this game being an Early Access title. Most of these issues will most likely be fixed down the road. Speedrunners is definately worth your time, and for $10, you'll definately get your money's worth out of it. I rate it an 8/10.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								So this is platformer based on fast phase running, precision jumping, precision wall sliding, precision grapling hook usage and some powerups usage. You and up to 3 competitors are thrown into running arena. You lose if you are last and touch screen borders. Winner of the match is the one who is last stanging or i should say running.You will need some time, like an 1 hour to pick up how to play and learn controls. Controls does respond well, but i had some issue on wall jumping/sliding, that jump does not work, and it got me frustrated, and i think it is not a bug. There just are some conditions when jumping on walls does not work - this means you are kinda doing it wrong or something like that. That set me back a lot, because fluidity is important thing in running games like this, and this felt like a cheap trick how to distribute luck factor in the game. Of course devs can keep opinion tham it is like that by design, and that i should invest more time learning controls.Overall I really enjoyed invested couple of hours in this game. Not really my type of game, but cant complain. Can see this as a fun game with friends, but they also have to be familiar with game before.Definitely bonus that there exists tutorial + kinda single-player mode.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								I've played quite a bit of this game.I bought it on the Holiday Sale after seeing some YouTubers play it and I've been in love with it ever since. Speedrunners is a surprisingly fun game that is fun for both casual and serious gamers, with the "Quick Match" or the "Ranked Match" multiplayer system. You can also create custom games and invite your friends to play.While this game is incredibly fun and is totally deserving of the money, in my experience I have experienced a few glitches that actually cause the game to break and/or crash. These glitches are actually pretty hilarious (and they aren't too frequent for me), so I really don't mind them personally, it's just something for you to keep in mind before you make the decision to purchase it.

								This game is very fast-paced, and a lot of fun. It contains obscure and not so obscure references. It's immpossible to tell who is winning because the game can change in the blink of an I. 10/10 would ice beam again.(definitely a lot more fun with friends, just a tip.)Regarding the friend issue, 4 players is great for playing against randoms, however their should be a custom game option that allows you to have up to, lets say, 8 seems like a good number.So 8 players in custom mode for a fun hectic, insane game that allows all of your friends to have fun and mess around.

Early Access Review
								Super Meat Boy meets Mario Kart with a little bit of Bionic Commando thrown in.  If any of that sounds remotely interesting then you will enjoy SpeedRunners.  The first few nights playing this game with friends my thumbs were hurting from playing the game so much.This game is still very much a beta.  The game can be a little buggy at times and it's best to play this with friends due to no matchmaking, but those little issues don't get in the way much of what is a very fun game.

Early Access Review
								This game is very fast-paced, and a lot of fun. It contains obscure and not so obscure references. The best part is when you think you are winning, and then your friend gets the ONE ITEM, that will allow him to catch up. It's immpossible to tell who is winning because the game can change in the blink of an I. 10/10 would ice beam again.(definitely a lot more fun with friends, just a tip.)Regarding the friend issue, 4 players is great for playing against randoms, however their should be a custom game option that allows you to have up to, lets say, 8 seems like a good number.So 8 players in custom mode for a fun hectic, insane game that allows all of your friends to have fun and mess around.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 11, 2015
Early Access Review
								Edit: gave up trying to join multiplayer, 3 hours tinkering and no dice. Uninstalling, and will leave this negative review as is.And no, I have good connection to play Dota 2 and CS: GO and even always online Diablo 3. Not my connection problem. Just a badly designed netcode in this game.Screenshot: http://steamcommunity.com/id/zeroxxx/screenshot/526140762130117960---Original review:Not fun when:1. You can't find any room although you've been searching for many minutes. Search range: worldwide. Probably Strict NAT issue for me, but it's still a minus point since many MP only games I play peer to peer even can pass thru Strict NAT.2. You don't have controllers (currently this game supports xinput but not dinput).It's fun when:1. You have local friends to play with (guaranteed 'room').2. You can find online rooms to play with.3. You have controllers.Game has single player mode, mostly for training purpose.Game has workshop support for additional free levels. Thank god no more paid mods after Skyrim fiasco.Game apparently has been on Early Access for so many months. Either no longer supported / slow-paced development or no more revenue to be taken from this game or combination of both.At the moment, no, I can't recommend the game. If you can get this cheaply from trading or free giveaways (so many recently) then go for it. At least you can play Single Player for 1 hour worth of content.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
Basically Mario Kart but with running, wall jumping, and grappling hooks.Very fun and fast-paced but easy for new players to pick up and enjoy.  Great for when friends are over, and a perfect title for Steam Link.Pros:- Endlessly fun and replayable- Online and local 4-player multiplayer- Online mode handles opponents with high ping fairly well- Very fair price and a 4-pack discount is available- Workshop support for player-made mapsCons:- Only a modest selection of official maps (16 currently) but they're high-quality- Not much variety in weapons/powerupsOther:- It's been in Early Access for a long time without many noteworthy changes but it felt like a "complete" game when I first bought it months ago, so I don't consider it worth complaining about- Originally it had only one racing music theme and it was so spectacularly perfect in every way that the newly-added music just can't match it- Recent updates have lowered the difficulty level a little bit too much in my opinion; hitting spikes and other traps used to be challenging to recover from but this is now only a minor setback9.5/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
												Yes I agree this game is great, original, fantastic etc.. exept when I found unfair mode and what exploits can be found to beat the game now once I found these exploits, I've been dashing through these AI games and regular games, which to me make this game completly broken and doesn't require any skill, once I learned the exploits it became second nature ultimately making the game skilless, the only good parts of this game I'd say is regular matched without exploits and no AI that can run faster than you.In my opinion, when you've played enough and learned enough, you become a god creating no challenges, but thats the point of games right? They have a goal and getting to the goal is a challenge, not in this game.But it's still great and fun if you don't come across anyone else in public games using these exploits, just play normally.Anyway I'm done with this game as soon as I've got all achievements.Still don't like unfair mode, almost directly forces you to use the exploits.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
Early Access Review
Basically Mario Kart but with running, wall jumping, and grappling hooks.Very fun and fast-paced but easy for new players to pick up and enjoy.  Great for when friends are over, and a perfect title for Steam Link.Pros:- Endlessly fun and replayable- Online and local 4-player multiplayer- Online mode handles opponents with high ping fairly well- Very fair price and a 4-pack discount is available- Workshop support for player-made mapsCons:- Only a modest selection of official maps (16 currently) but they're high-quality- Not much variety in weapons/powerupsOther:- It's been in Early Access for a long time without many noteworthy changes but it felt like a "complete" game when I first bought it months ago, so I don't consider it worth complaining about- Originally it had only one racing music theme and it was so spectacularly perfect in every way that the newly-added music just can't match it- Recent updates have lowered the difficulty level a little bit too much in my opinion; hitting spikes and other traps used to be challenging to recover from but this is now only a minor setback9.5/10

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								I bought the 4 pack during the latest holiday sale and gave it away to my friends.  It looked fun.   Playing it is more than just fun.  This has become the go to local co-op game for my roommate and friends on the couch.  It is a great game in the sense it balances simple play, amazing ability to push your play to a graceful sublime edge, and it is quick enough a match to make you always want more.  As yourself and the group you play with get better the levels themselves start to change a bit.  Not as much as in other racing games i've played but enough that you can see who knows what they are doing and who doesn't know yet.  It is worth more than they are asking at $9.99 and the game isn't even done yet.  All I can ask for is more runners, more tools, more stages, and for more people to enjoy this gem.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
Early Access Review
								This is a rad little game. Kind of like a Grapple Boy meets Fancy Pants adventures I guess?? You and 3 other players are racing around a stage over and over again, trying to get so far ahead of the others that they fall off the screen and die. Once the first player has died, the visible area of the screen starts to shrink, and the threshold to stay alive becomes smaller and smaller until one person's left. First to three points wins. It's still in beta so the game will glitch up every once in a while, but it's really fun. There's already a metagame developing for when to use items, the best ways to get through each path, etc. This game is a blast.

content:
Posted: October 8, 2013
Early Access Review
								So in normal multiplayer platformers, you've got that pesky screen-sharing limitation. Well, this is what happens when you take scrolling deaths to their logical conclusion: a racing platformer that revolves around getting everyone else off the screen! Throw in a Mario Kart-esque item system, and there' a recipe for ridiculous fun.There aren't any blue shells, either!
